bang.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a sudden loud noise caused by something such as a gun or an object hitting a hard surface
bang.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: There was a loud bang outside the kitchen door.
bang.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a painful blow to the body when you hit against something or something hits you
bang.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to hit something hard, making a loud noise
bang.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The baby kept banging the table with his spoon.
She banged her fist on the table.
bang.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to put something down or against something with a lot of force, making a loud noise
bang.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He banged a teapot on the table.
bang.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to close something violently, making a loud noise, or to be closed in this way
bang.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: I ran out, banging the door behind me.
bang.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to hit a part of your body, or something you are carrying, against something by accident
bang.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: I fell and banged my head on the pavement.
bang.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to make a loud noise or loud noises
bang.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: The gate keeps banging in the wind.
bang.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The train arrived bang on time.
The technology is bang up to date.
bang.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: I skidded and went bang into the wall.
bang.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: used to make a sound like a gun or bomb
